fields.description:
h3. Summary
In some cases, invitation emails to customers will never arrive in the customer's inbox due to overzealous spam filtering or the vagaries of the Internet. This can result in needing to send another invitation to the customer.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Send an invitation email from Service Desk to a customer.
# Send a second one to the same email address.

h3. Expected results
Either Service Desk sends the email again, or it pops up a message saying that the user already exists and they'll need to use the "Forgotten your password" link on the login page.

h3. Actual results
Service Desk shows the green tick like the email has been sent, but no actual email is ever sent and there's no feedback at all about what's happened.

h3. Workaround
Tell the customer to use the "Forgotten your password" link on the login page to set a password.
fields.summary: Customer invitation emails are never resent despite the UI saying so

fields.description:

Caused by: JSD-1663
fields.summary: Customer Portal Severe Performance Degradation When Large Number of Requests

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When creating a new custom automation rule and choosing 'SLA time remaining' as the trigger, error 'This trigger could not be loaded' is thrown. Also, if there is any existing automation rule that contains 'SLA time remaining' as a trigger, this cannot be edited to point to another SLA metric.

h3. Environment

Affects cloud v1000.217.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Access your Service Desk project settings
# Choose *Automation* on the left panel options
# Select *Add rule* > *Custom rule*
# In the WHEN section, choose *SLA time remaining*

h3. Expected Results

The trigger is added and you can continue with creating your automation rule

h3. Actual Results

Error *This trigger could not be loaded* is thrown:

 !Pasted_Image_11_08_16_14_57.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
You may see an error similar to this in the Developer Console of your browser

{noformat}
Error rendering form Error: No servicedesk/internal/feature/sla-when-handler/sla-when-condition(…) batch.js?agile_global_admin_condition=true&atlassian.aui.raphael.disabled=true&is-system-admin=true…:1072 Error rendering form d_changing: false_events: Object_listenerId: "l31"_listeners: Object_pending: false_previousAttributes: Objectattributes: Objectchanged: Objectcid: "c29"collection: d__proto__: d Error: No servicedesk/internal/feature/sla-when-handler/sla-when-condition(…)
{noformat}

h3.Workaround

No workaround at the moment
fields.summary: When creating a custom automation rule, 'SLA time remaining' cannot be added as a trigger

fields.description:
Through the Automation plugin of JIRA Agile it's possible to create a rule to Alert users when a given condition is met.
In this rule it's possible to select the users to be mentioned in the issue, like another agent or even a collaborator, however, JIRA Service Desk also lets the user to select the Service Desk customers on the rule, despite the inability to mention them directly by inserting the mention in the issue comment.
By the time the mention occurs, this customers are mentioned in a restricted Internal Comment which they don't have visibility, so no emails will be sent to them.

*Steps to reproduce*
* Create a Service Desk;
* Set a new automation rule of type "Alert user";
* Put a Service Desk customer name on it.

*Expected 1*
If the user can be mentioned in the rule, he should receive the emails.

*Expected 2*
It shouldn't be possible to select them in the rule.

*Actual*
It's possible to select this users but no email is triggered.
fields.summary: Automation rule of type Alert user lets you select customers on it

fields.description:
*Symptoms*
* The JIRA add-on will say 105 of 105 enabled.
* Clicking on 'Getting Started' will not work
* Unable to start evaluation

*Workaround*
Restart the JIRA Service Desk add-on. You should now see 194 of 194 modules.

*Cause*
The JIRA Service Desk plugin waits for a specific event during start-up which indicates that the plugin has been licensed properly. Changes to the platform now cause the plugin to receive the event before becoming licensed and so the plugin does not start up fully.
Restarting the plugin will cause JIRA Service Desk to get the right licensing information when starting-up.
fields.summary: Not all modules are being enabled properly in OnDemand

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When sharing a KB link from:
* the KB panel related articles
!image-2016-06-29-11-37-08-852.png|thumbnail! 
* the KB dialog viewer (opened from related articles or articles search results)
!image-2016-06-29-11-37-56-298.png|thumbnail! 

Clicking on the link posted in the new issue comment opens the KB viewer dialog but doesn't load the article content and is broken.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Share a KB article from the KB panel (for an issue created from the customer portal)
# Click on the shared link in the comment added to the issue

h3. Expected Results
The KB viewer dialog opens and load the shared article correctly.

h3. Actual Results
The KB viewer dialog opens but doesn't load the article and shows the following:
!image-2016-06-29-11-47-12-412.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
This doesn't happen with an issue created from JIRA (that doesn't have a JSD request type)

The wiki-markup generated for the comment is broken, as the url parameters look like:
{code}
[JIRA_BASE_URL]?title=TEST Home&spaceKey=TEST&applicationId=d290d330-3228-3fd7-bd0b-bc417ecf28ad?requestKey=TEST-1&portalId=1
{code}
The parameter {{requestKey}} coming after {{applicationId}} is appended starting with a "?".

h3.Workaround
* fix the url (before or after the link has been shared) by replacing the falsey "?" by a "&".
* search for the article from the the KB panel in the agent view OR from the portal using the link title (which is the page name)
fields.summary: "Cannot display article" in agent view when opening a shared KB link

fields.description:
*Upgrading to version 2 pricing model for JIRA Service Desk Cloud*

According to the upgrade process described on [this page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/ONDEMANDKB/Upgrading+to+JIRA+Service+Desk+2.0+and+moving+to+the+version+2+pricing+model], under 'Stage 1: Switching to the version 2 pricing model' in *Step 2*, Cloud users must locate the *service-desk-agents* group to add the users on the agent list they made in *Step 1* to this group. Adding your agents to the group in this step ensures that the agents will already have the license allocated to them after you apply the version 2 license key afterwards. This ensures that there will be no down time for agents and they can continue working with issues and communicating with customers while you make the other changes to complete the upgrade in stage 2.

*Problem*

There is no *service-desk-agents* group, and if you try to create a group with the same name to proceed with the upgrade, later on Service Desk will *not* recognize it as a valid group, and will display the following error when you attempt to "Make user an agent":

!SD-error.png!

*Workaround*

(!) Yes, there will be down time for agents and they won't be able to continue working with issues and communicating with customers until the upgrade is complete.

a. *IF* you haven't manually created a group named *service-desk-agents* to proceed with the upgrade, *don't do it*. Proceed with the upgrade and once completed, Service Desk will create the group for you.

b. *IF* you have created a group named *service-desk-agents*, completed the process and you're getting the error in the image above, go to your User Management system and *delete* this group. Service Desk will automatically create a group with the same name and you will be able to make users agents.
fields.summary: Service Desk doesn't have 'service-desk-agents' group by default

fields.description:
h3. Step to replicate
# Turn on service desk notification.
# Create a service desk ticket.
# Comment on it twice. Comment the second time right after you add the first comment.
# Check your mail queue should have notification mail render for both updates.
# Check your mail inbox to find both notifications mail regarding the two comments update.
# Both the notification mail is the same. Please find the example screenshots below: !comment1.png|thumbnail!
!comment2.png|thumbnail!
# Add in the third comment after a minute. The notification seem to be working fine again.
!comment3.png|thumbnail!

In this case testing is done on service desk v1 pricing. Thus service desk customer is a JIRA user as well.
The workaround will be:
* Turn off service desk notification and use JIRA notification scheme instead.
fields.summary: Service Desk Customer received two identical notification emails when two comments update is done continuously within a minute

fields.description:
h2.Summary

It is now possible add JIRA Service Desk customers as assignee and watchers via email.

h2.Steps to Replicate
# Go to JIRA incoming mail handler page and edit the mail handler of an existing project. Tick 'CC Assignee' and 'CC Watchers'.
# Create a Service Desk customer.
# Send an email to create a ticket in the mail handler edited on step. Make sure to include the customer in step 2 to the CC field.

h2.Expected Results
Service Desk customers should never be added as assignees or watchers.

h2.Current Results
You can add customers to assignee and watchers via email using the CC field.
fields.summary: JIRA Incoming Mail handler add Service Desk customers as watchers and assignee when they are added in CC field

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When setting up a custom email channel in a JIRA Service Desk project, if you use the same username to authenticate into multiple projects JIRA SD will prevent you from actually completing the process to create the custom email channel.

h3. How to reproduce

# Go to Service Desk project 1
# Insert a custom email handler eg. customersupport@servicedesk.com and on the username to authenticate use jira@servicedesk.com
# Go to Service Desk project 2 
# Insert a custom email handler eg. helpcenter@servicedesk.com and on the username to authenticate use jira@servicedesk.com.

h3. Expected Behavior

The custom email handler would be added without a problem since the email handler address is different and only the username authenticating is the same.

h3. Actual Results

JIRA SD will display an error in the UI:

"Unable to create new mail channel due to connection duplication.Provided mail connection definition is currently used by another mail channel. Check out our troubleshooting docs for help resolving the issue."

 !Screen Shot 2017-03-30 at 3.28.23 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Affected Version

- JIRA v1000.870.2

h3. Workaround

Use a different username to auth and the email handler will be added just fine.
fields.summary: Using a Custom Email Handler with the same username to authenticate in multiple projects is not possible

fields.description:

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Service Desk customer is not able to access Confluence label. It is not mentioned at [Linking to a knowledge base|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/serving-customers-with-a-knowledge-base-732528995.html#Servingcustomerswithaknowledgebase-Linkingaknowledgebase]:
{quote}
Unlicensed Confluence users cannot:

- See the Confluence dashboard, user profiles, the people directory, or the space directly

{quote}

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Service desk will show the article inside the customer portal
# Click on any related article and the linked confluence space will be opened. 
# Customer click on any label on the linked article in the confluence

fields.description:
The summary of some of the issues were becoming ‘null’ when carried out a transition. They were in a Service Desk Project and during the automatic transition ‘Respond to customer’ via comments (automatic transition when a comment is made), the summary became null. This happened with the default workflow created by Service Desk.

After investigation, we found out that the problem happened because the ‘Respond to customer’ had associated a screen with the summary. Removing the ‘summary’ field from this screen solves the problem (though it does not fix the issues that have already a null summary).

When carrying out the transition, an error is shown to the user. Also, when viewing the issue in the quick view, the same error occurs. Both throw the same NPE with the following stack trace.
{noformat}
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at java.security.MessageDigest.update(MessageDigest.java:293)
	at java.security.MessageDigest.digest(MessageDigest.java:368)
	at org.apache.commons.codec.digest.DigestUtils.md5(DigestUtils.java:165)
	at org.apache.commons.codec.digest.DigestUtils.md5(DigestUtils.java:190)
	at org.apache.commons.codec.digest.DigestUtils.md5Hex(DigestUtils.java:226)
	at com.atlassian.jira.components.issueeditor.action.DefaultContentIdCollector.calculateContentId(DefaultContentIdCollector.java:59)
	at com.atlassian.jira.components.issueviewer.viewissue.IssueSummaryProvider.check(IssueSummaryProvider.java:18)
	at com.atlassian.jira.components.issueviewer.action.AjaxIssueAction.populateIssueFields(AjaxIssueAction.java:166)
	at com.atlassian.jira.components.issueviewer.action.AjaxIssueAction.doDefault(AjaxIssueAction.java:140)
...
{noformat}

This is the error:
!null_summary_issue_view_error.png!

It reads: There was an unexpected error while loading the issue. If you think this message is wrong, please contact your JIRA administrators.


*Steps to reproduce*
* Have ‘Service Desk’ enabled
* Create a Service Desk project (all default)
* Go to the project’s only workflow, find the screen for the ‘Respond to Customer’ transition (there is already one) and add the ‘Summary’ field to it
* Create an issue in this project
* Have two different users, one set as the reporter, the other as the assignee (it does not seem to work if they are the same)
* Transition the issue until it is in the ‘Waiting for Support’ status 
** Actually, this is probably the first status, so there will be no need to change it, but make sure it indeed is.
* Log in as the assignee user
* Go to the issue
* Make a comment
* The transition will be triggered and an error will appear. The issue’s summary will be null

*Workaround*
* Fixing the screen 
** Go to the screen and remove the summary field from it
** Unfortunately, after this it will be impossible to change the summary if you use the ‘Send to Customer’ button (change manually, if needed)
* Fixing the bugged issues
** Find the issues that had their summary set as null before correction, by running the SQL:
{code:sql}
select project.pkey, issuenum, project from jiraissue left join project on jiraissue.project = project.id where summary is null;
{code}
** Find the issue key, by joining “<pkey>-<issuenum>” from the SQL
** Open the issue in the UI and give it a summary (it will have ‘null’ written in it).

This should do it.
fields.summary: Summary is set as null when auto-transitioning via Service Desk using comments

fields.description:
h3. Summary

A user has an automation rule in place in his instance. The event that triggers this rule is Issue Creation. There are three components in place. For each component, the 'If' in the rule is If component = 'insert component', THEN alert user. The issue is that when the portal customer creates the request, the rule fires but the customer can see the alert in the Activity, which should be internal. After refreshing the browser page, the Activity section and alert disappears.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Verify that automation rule described in summary is in place.
# Log in as portal customer. Create a request.
# Choose a Component. All other fields can be whatever you want.
# The activity section will display an alert to an agent.
# Refresh page.
# The alert goes away.

h3. Expected Results
The alert should only show to the Service Desk Agents.

h3. Actual Results
The alert shows to the portal customer as well (until the page is refreshed).
 
h3. Notes
This appears to happen intermittently, and might be a race condition.

h3.Workaround
None at this time.
fields.summary: Internal Portal Comments from Automation Rule show as External

fields.description:
Steps to replicate:

# Set up a JIRA Service Desk with incoming email configured
# Email the email address set up in step 1
# Reply to the email created in step 2 (making sure the email address from step 1 is in the "to:" list)

Result:

Two JIRA issues are created

Expected Result:

One JIRA issue is created from the email sent in step 2, and then a comment is added to that ticket from the email sent in step 3. This is the behaviour that JIRA Core currently demonstrates.
fields.summary: Replying to an email sent to a Service Desk creates a new issue rather than creating a comment

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Service desk projects' sidebar breaks and  results in a blank page when there are add-ons installed in the instance. So far, it looks to be affecting the following add-ons:
* Tempo Timesheets by Tempo
* Canvas for JIRA by Comalatech
* Automated Log Work for JIRA by Gebsun

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Subscribe for Tempo Timesheets/Canvas for JIRA;
# Create a Service Desk Project
#  Click on Timesheets/Canvas at the left sidebar

h3. Expected behaviour
The link should redirect to the respective add-on's page. 

h3. Current behaviour
See that the *Project Administration* tab sticks at the top blue bar and nothing else is visible.

h3. Workaround 
# For Tempo Timesheets enabled instances:
* Disable the {{tempo-project-sidebar-timesheet}} and  {{tempo-project-sidebar-timesheet-panel}} modules from _Tempo Timesheets_ add-on.
* Use the Tempo tab at the top of the page instead.

h3. Affected versions:
* Tempo Timesheets
** v7.1.0-OD-02-025
** v7.1.0-OD-02-030
* Canvas for JIRA
** 2.0.58-AC
* Automated Log Work
** 1.0.30-AC

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The customer portal displays a JSON blob instead of the contents of the customer portal.

{code}
{"helpCenterBranding":{"headerBGColor":"","headerLinkColor":"","headerLinkHoverColor":"","headerLinkHoverBGColor":"","logoUrl":"","logoId":"","helpCenterTitle":"Welcome to the Help Center","sharedPortalName":"Help Center","translations":{"en-US":{"helpCenterTitle":"Welcome to the Help Center","sharedPortalName":"Help Center","localeDisplayName":"English (United States) [Default]"}},"siteDefaultLanguageTag":"en-US","userLanguageTag":"en-US"},"portal"
[...]
{code}

h3. Notes
Our developers have identified the issue and are preparing a fix at the moment. We will keep the progress updated on http://status.atlassian.com/incidents/x7fdpcbxpv8z

h3. Workaround
We can temporarily disable the CDN on instances until the proper fix is in place, please raise a support request at [support.atlassian.com/contact|https://support.atlassian.com/contact/] and reference this ticket number to have that performed if necessary.

h3. Summary

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to Project SLA Administration
# Click Calendars and add new calendar
# Edit or create a new metric
# Attempt to update Goal Calendar to a Custom Calendar or
# Attempt to Create new Goal with Custom Calendar
# Calendar reverts to default

Goal should update to selected Calendar.

h3. Actual Results
Calendar reverts to the Default Calendar

{"errors":[{"errorMessage":"This request type is the default request type for the email channel."}],"reasonKey":"sd.admin.request.type.error.used.by.email.settings","reasonCode":"400"}{noformat}

Related bug: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSD-4097

h3. Summary
For Service Desk projects that have a KB associated, when seeing issues in the issue view (/browse/ABC-123), the KB options (under Related knowledge base articles) are not available.

Affected features:
# List of related articles
# The ‘Create article’ button

This is not happening in the ‘Queues’ page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have a Cloud JIRA (with SD) + Confluence Cloud instance
# Create an SD project and associate it with KB space in Confluence (say, project key ABC)
# Create a ticket either in Customer Portal or in the create button (say, issue key ABC-1)
# Access this ticket in the 'Queues' page (https://instance.atlassian.net/projects/ABC/queues/1/ABC-1)
# Access this ticket in issue view (https://instance.atlassian.net/browse/ABC-1)

h3. Expected Results
Both show the options under ‘Related knowledge base articles’ correctly and they work.

h3. Actual Results
The issue in the 'Queues' page works correctly, but the one in issue view doesn’t. These are the problems:
# Where the list of related KBs should be, we see this error:
{noformat}
Snap! Something didn't work as expected. Try refreshing the page or contact your administrator.
{noformat}
# The ‘Create article’ button doesn’t respond
# The browser’s JavaScript console shows the following errors:
{noformat}
https://instance.atlassian.net/rest/servicedesk/knowledgebase/latest/articles/undefined?_=1460649559098 Failed to load resource: the server responded with a status of 412 ()
{noformat}

h3.Workaround
* View issues in the 'Queues' page, or
* Reload the issue by clicking on the issue key link at the top of the page (refreshing the page does not work)

h3. Summary

When a user without Confluence 'create page' permission attempts to create an article from Service Desk they get redirected back to the queues page with an "Issue Does Not Exist" dialog.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Setup an application link between JIRA and Confluence and using the Knowledge Base Settings, link a Service Desk to a Confluence space.
# Create a user that does not have Confluence create page permission for the linked space, this user should exist both in Confluence and JIRA. 
# Attempt to create an article through the 'create an article' link in the KB panel in an issue.

h3. Expected Results
A new window shows up trying to load the newly created draft but since the user does not have create page permission the window closes and the user is shown the create kb dialog with an error.

h3. Actual Results
A new window shows up trying to load the newly created draft and the user is redirected back to queues page with a 'Issue Does Not Exist' dialog/

h3. Notes
This can also be reproduced without a common user between JIRA and Confluence by having anonymous access turned on for the linked Confluence space.

h3.Workaround
This does not break any existing functionality, if the user has permission to create page permission in Confluence then they will not experience this error. 

The user can close the new window if they experience this.

fields.description:
h2.Summary
Current SLA fields like 'Time to Resolution' are not sorted correctly in Issue Navigator. According to https://jdog.jira-dev.com/browse/DESK-1861 , the SLA should be sorted based on time remaining and also whether the SLAs are still on-going or completed.

{quote}
So customers don't get confused about SLA sort order - it should be:

- All ongoing SLAs by time remaining
- All completed SLAs by time remaining
{quote}

h2.Steps to Replicate
Get an instance with lots of Service Desk tickets and SLA data. Go to the Issue Navigator and sort all the Service Desk tickets based on 'Time to Resolution'

h2.Expected Result
SLAs should be categorized by the following order :

# Whether it is completed or ongoing, if ongoing it will be shown first.
# Once the SLA are properly grouped based on the first criteria, tickets are then sorted based on remaining time.

h2.Current Result

Currently, ongoing ticket SLAs are sorted fine. SLA that are completed however are *NOT* sorted.

!Untitled.png|thumbnail!

Based on the thumbnail above, the ongoing tickets are sorted correctly but the completed tickets are not.
fields.summary: SLA fields are not sorted correctly in Issue Navigator

This is not happening in Business projects or tickets in SD projects without Request Types.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a user with {{JIRA Service Desk}} Application Access
# Change its {{My Changes}} option in profile to {{Notify me}} 
# Create a Service Desk project and add that user to {{JIRA Service Desk}}
#* By default, Reporters should be notified of this ticket
# Log in as that user and create a ticket in Customer Portal (making sure the ticket as a Request Type)

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create a new Service Desk project
# Go to Reports > Created vs. Resolved, the right-most datapoint should be "2" on the Y-axis, for the two default demo issues that are created when the project is created
# Change the scale to "Past year by month", the right-most X-axis label is the current month
# Set the computer's system timezone to a timezone that is behind the user's JIRA profile timezone setting (if the user has GMT+10 set, change the OS to GMT+9)
# Refresh the reports page

h3. Expected results
The report looks exactly the same after changing the timezone as it did before (the right-most X-axis label is still the current month).

h3. Actual results
The graph data remains the same, but the X-axis labels shift back a month, so the right-most label is now last month.

h3. Notes
The raw data for the report is pulled from {{/rest/servicedesk/reports/1/servicedesk/<project>/report/<report ID>?timescaleId=8}} and the timestamps are given in milliseconds since Unix epoch time. In the current month of June, when all timezones are the same between OS and JIRA, that last data point is {{1464703200000}} which resolves to 00:00 on the 1st of June 2016 GMT+10 (open the browser's developer Javascript console when the report is open and type {{moment(1464703200000);}}). After changing the OS timezone to GMT+9, that same Javascript command returns 23:00 on the 31st of May 2016 instead.

h3. Workaround
Ensure JIRA's profile timezone setting matches what your computer's OS is set to.
fields.summary: X-axis labels on reports display incorrectly when user's system timezone is behind JIRA user profile timezone

fields.description:
h6.Steps to reproduce 1
# make sure that 'Fix Version' field is configured for the relevant issue types and screens (it's not in the default Service Desk project configuration);
# add 'Fix Version' (but no 'Affects Version') field to a Customer Request form;
# attempt to create a Customer Request with the form configured in previous step.

*Expected result:* 'Fix Version' is displayed as the rest of the fields.
*Actual result:* 'Fix Version' isn't displayed in the Customer Portal, although it can be displayed and edited in the agent view. If the field is required, an error is thrown at an attempt to submit the request:
!Screen Shot 2015-03-12 at 13.51.04.png|thumbnail!

h6.Steps to reproduce 2
# add both 'Affects Version' and 'Fix Version' fields to a Customer Request form;
# create a Customer Request with the 'Affects Version' value only.

*Expected result:* 'Fix Version' is displayed as empty and 'Affects Version' with the assigned value.
*Actual result:* both fields are displayed with the value of 'Affects Version'.
!versions1.png|thumbnail!
!versions2.png|thumbnail!

h6.Cause and workaround
 The 'Affected Version' field renderer is used for the 'Fixed Version' field. The workaround, then, is to add the 'Affected Version' field to the form and assign a value to it to make sure it's displayed.
fields.summary: 'Affected Version' displayed instead of 'Fix Version' Field in Customer Portal

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When adding comments in pop-up windows in SD requests, the 'Internal comment's tab is not responding.

For example, if you have a Service Desk project which is shown in an Agile board, when viewing it in the Detail View in Backlog or Active Sprint pages, if you click to comment on it, the pop up page has an 'Internal Comment' tab that doesn't respond anymore.

This is also failing when transitioning the issue when it has comment in the transition screen. The pop-up window to transition has an 'Internal comment' tab that doesn't respond.

h3.Workaround
The Internal comment functionality can also be accessed directly from the ticket. Navigate to the issue and add any internal comments there.

h3. Environment
Replicated in these versions:
* JIRA v7.2.0-OD-03-005
* JIRA Service Desk v3.2.0-OD-04-003-D20160224T230516
* JIRA Agile v7.2.2-D20160223T031242

h3. Steps to Reproduce

h4. Scenario 1. When transitioning
# Create a Service Desk project
# Create a request in this project
# Make sure you have a transition to the customer with comments (should be there by default as 'Respond to Customer')
# Click the transition
# Click the 'Internal comment' tab

h4. Scenario 2: In an Agile board
# Create a Service Desk project
# Create a board (either Scrum or Kanban) associated with this project (showing issues from it)
# Make sure you have requests in the project
# Go to the boards Backlog or Active Sprint page, where there is at least one issue
# Click it to open its Detail View
# In 'Comments' section, click the 'Comment' button
#* A Comment pop-up window will appear
# Click the 'Internal comment' tab

h3. Expected Results
In both cases, the 'Internal comment' tab should be selected and this message should appear:
{quote}
Your comments will not be visible to customers on the portal.
{quote}

h3. Actual Results
The tab doesn't respond.

No errors in logs, but this appears in JavaScript console when accessing the board:
{noformat}
RapidBoard.jspa:1 Uncaught (in promise) undefined
https://theeagle-sd.atlassian.net/rest/dev-status/1.0/issue/summary?issueId=undefined&_=1456420549436 Failed to load resource: the server responded with a status of 400 (Bad Request)
{noformat}

h3. Notes
This is a very recent bug, because I cannot replicate in these versions (which at the time that the affected version was release, some instances were still using):
* JIRA v7.2.0-OD-02-009
* JIRA Service Desk v3.2.0-OD-03-003-D20160217T060814
* JIRA Agile v7.2.1-D20160217T041804

There was a similar bug:
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSD-2292

But this current bug seems to start happening in a much earlier version. As I mentioned above, version JIRA SD v3.2.0-OD-03 was not affected and that other bug is for version 2.5.4.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Comments are not being posted in the correct project when customer is replying via email.

h3. Environment
* JIRA Service Desk Application v3.3.0-OD-1000.666.0
* JIRA Service Desk Application v3.3.0-OD-1000.714.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a JSD project with email request enabled (e.g.: _projectA@atlassian.net_)
# Create another JSD project with email request enabled (e.g.: _projectB@atlassian.net_)
# Have a customer send a request via email {{TO: _projectA@atlassian.net_ and _projectB@atlassian.net_)
#* Two tickets will be created by JSD (one in _projectA_ ({{PA-1}}) and another one in _projectB_ ({{PB-1}}))
# Ask the same customer to reply to that email

h3. Expected Results
A single comment will be added into each ticket {{PA-1}} and {{PB-1}}.

h3. Actual Results
The reply from the customer is added into {{PA-1}} twice.
 
h3. Notes
- When receiving the reply, JSD is only considering the first email address that was in the original request (changing the order of the email addresses in the {{TO}} field do not change the effect).
- If the customer add both issue-keys in the subject, the same behavior happens.
- If request participants reply to the email, the comment does not get in.
- Processing logs show that all the replies were successfully processed by JSD in both projects.

h3.Workaround
None.
fields.summary: Comment from email not working

fields.description:
This only affects OnDemand, if Service Desk has not been migrated to 2.0 (Agent Based Pricing).

In a Service Desk project any comment made by an Agent will Auto transition the issue to 'Waiting For Customer'. This also happens in the normal JIRA view, previously this was not the case.

This does not affect Service Desk 2.0 as the tabs will indicate when a transition will happen.

*workaround*
Upgrade to Service Desk 2.0, which will include Agent Based Pricing. See this [Article how to perform this in OnDemand|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/ONDEMANDKB/Upgrading+to+JIRA+Service+Desk+2.0+and+moving+to+the+version+2+pricing+model]

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In a specific setting in SD projects, issues are 'transitioning', in a way that they are changing the 'stepId' of issues, but not updating their status, leaving the issues in an invalid state.

This happens when:
# There's an SLA configuration setting 2 different goals based on a field (only tested with 'Priority)
# The transition has the first (or one of the first) post-functions setting that same custom field
#* This also happens if we set the field in a a screen in the transition instead of a post-function
# There's an automation rule to when this same SLA is due soon 


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an SD project
# Create an SLA
# Create two goals with this configuration:
#* {{priority = Highest}} - 1h
#* All remaining issues - 4h
# Create an automation rule:
#* The 'When' is 'SLA time remaining is due soon (60 min. remaining)
# Create a post function in the 'Respond to customer' transition from 'Waiting for Support' to 'Waiting for customer'
#* Add it as the first post function
#* Select the 'Update field' and select 'priority', set as 'Highest'
# Create a ticket and trigger the 'Respond to customer' transition

h3. Expected Results
The issue is transitions correctly.

h3. Actual Results
The issue is transitions, as it's step ID is changed, but the 'status' is not, and the issue enters and invalid state. The issue remains in status 'Waiting for Support', but the transitions available are those you'd expected for issues in 'Waiting for Customer'.

Integrity Checker shows this:
{noformat}
ERROR: ABC-123 - The current step associated with the workflow entry with id 12345 has an incorrect stepId. (JRA-4539)
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
If we run this command, we can see that the step ID's in fact changed, though the status has not:
{code:sql}
select * from os_currentstep where entry_id =12345;
{code}

Replace 12345 by the one returned by Integrity Checker.

h3.Workaround
The best way to fix this issue is to remove the post-function. If possible, try using something else instead.
fields.summary: Transition is not changing status with combination of SLA, automation and post-function

fields.description:
*Symptoms*
* Goals that have the cascadeOption function are not triggering when they should or are triggering when they shouldn't
* The exact same search in the issue navigator returns the issues expected.

*Cause*
The SLA's run the queries in a no-permissions mode, as the action is done by the system and not by a user. A recent change in JIRA has caused the no-permissions mode check to require a user and not behave properly.
fields.summary: cascadeOption function causes inconsistent behaviour with SLA's

fields.description:
h3. Summary
SD projects that are firing events other than 'Issue Created', even if the template is 'Issue Created', are not showing any SLA that is started with 'Issue Created'.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
To replicate the problem:
# Create a ‘Basic Service Desk’ project
#* It comes with an existing SLA ({{Time to resolution}}) that starts on the issue creation, use that to test
# Create a new event {{New Create Issue Event}} with Template {{Issue Created}}
# Edit {{JIRA Service Desk IT Support Workflow generated for Project}} Workflow
#* In ‘Create’ transition edit the '{{Fire a Issue Created event that can be processed by the listeners}}' post-function, replace by '{{Fire a New Create Issue Event event that can be processed by the listeners}}'
#* Publish workflow
# Create a {{Get IT Help}} ticket (or any other using the same 'Workflow') (ticket 1)
# Change post-function back to fire {{Issue Created}} and publish
# Create another ticket using the same request type (ticket 2)

h3. Expected Results
The SLA is shown in both tickets.

h3. Actual Results
# The ticket 1 does not contain any SLA even though it should. Ticket 2 is working fine, as it uses the original event.
 
h3. Notes
# This is how the field looked in the database in a ticket with this problem
{code:sql}
select cfv.textvalue from customfieldvalue cfv join customfield cf on cfv.customfield = cf.id where cf.cfname = 'Time to resolution' and cfv.issue = (select jiraissue.id from jiraissue join project on jiraissue.project = project.id where project.pkey = 'PROJ' and jiraissue.issuenum = 1);
                                                                                                                                 textvalue                                                                
                                                                  
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
------------------------------------------------------------------
 {"timeline":{"events":[]},"ongoingSLAData":null,"completeSLAData":[],"metricId":1,"definitionChangeDate":0,"definitionChangeMsEpoch":0,"goalsChangeDate":null,"goalsChangeMsEpoch":null,"goalTimeUpdatedD
ate":null,"goalTimeUpdatedMsEpoch":null,"metricCreatedDate":null}
(1 row)
{code}

# This is how the working ticket looks in the database (you can see that there are events in this case):
{code:sql}
select cfv.textvalue from customfieldvalue cfv join customfield cf on cfv.customfield = cf.id where cf.cfname = 'Time to resolution' and cfv.issue = (select jiraissue.id from jiraissue join project on jiraissue.project = project.id where project.pkey = 'TSDP' and jiraissue.issuenum = 4);
                                                                                                                                                                                                          
                                                                      textvalue                                                                                                                           
                                                                                                                                                      
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 {"timeline":{"events":[{"date":1467054798104,"types":["START"]}]},"ongoingSLAData":{"goalId":2,"startTime":1467054798104,"paused":false,"thresholdData":{"calculatedAt":1467054798104,"remainingTime":144
00000,"thresholdsConfigChangeDate":1467054155604,"thresholdsConfigChangeMsEpoch":1467054155604}},"completeSLAData":[],"metricId":1,"definitionChangeDate":0,"definitionChangeMsEpoch":0,"goalsChangeDate":
1467054155755,"goalsChangeMsEpoch":1467054155755,"goalTimeUpdatedDate":1467054155734,"goalTimeUpdatedMsEpoch":1467054155734,"metricCreatedDate":null}
(1 row)
{code}

h3. Partial Workaround
# Change the fired event to 'Issue Created' to prevent future tickets to be created without SLA
# Use the workaround [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/missing-sla-data-in-jira-servicedesk-828790603.html] to fix existing ones (sending too many issues at once may cause a time-out)
fields.summary: Firing different event than 'Issue Created' in 'Create' transition prevents SLA from showing in tickets

fields.description:
According to this [document|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Configuring+public+signup#Configuringpublicsignup-EnablingCAPTCHA], to enable CAPTCHA in JIRA Service Desk. JIRA CAPTCHA setting should be enabled in JIRA. To enable it in JIRA, public signup should be enabled.

*Steps to Reproduce*
# Enable Public Signup for JIRA
# Enable Public Signup for JIRA Service Desk 
# Tried to signup for JIRA, CAPTCHA is enabled
# Tried to signup for JIRA Service Desk customer, CAPTCHA is disabled 

*Expected Results*
Once public signup is enabled in JIRA and JIRA Service Desk, it should enable CAPTCHA for JIRA and Service Desk. 

*Actual Results*
After enabling pubic signup for JIRA and JIRA Service Desk, CAPTCHA is enabled in JIRA but not on JIRA Service Desk.
fields.summary: After enabling pubic signup for JIRA and JIRA Service Desk, CAPTCHA is enabled in JIRA but not in JIRA Service Desk

fields.description:
h4. Summary

When disabling Service Desk notifications, JIRA by default should use its own notifications but its not.
As example: if someone create an issue on behalf of a customer, JIRA understands that the customer did the action and do not send notifications for the customer.  

Note: By default users does not get notified of their own changes.

h4. Steps to reproduce

# Create a Service Desk
# Disable Service Desk notifications
# Create a notification scheme for the Service Desk Project
# Configure the Event "Issue Created" adding the value "Reporter"
# Create an issue in Customer Portal on behalf of a customer.

h4. Expected Behavior 

If the notification setting for JSD is disable then JIRA notification scheme works as defined for all users including customers.
fields.summary: Service Desk does not inherit JIRA notifications when JSD Notifications is disabled.

fields.description:
h2.Summary

When adding a public comment during a transition, Service Desk sees that the status changed first and only then the comment is added. This causing Service Desk to perform the automation while the issue in a wrong status.

h2.Steps to Replicate
# Create a new Basic Service Desk Project.
# Create a new workflow and it should contain the below transition:
#* !Selection_087.png|thumbnail!
# Add a screen to the _Waiting for Approval_ to _Waiting for Support_ transition
# Add a new issue commented automation rule to the Service Desk:
#* {code}* WHEN *Comment is added to an issue*
* IF *Issue matches: Status = "Waiting for support" / "Customer Request Type" is not empty / Comment is public / User is not a customer*
** THEN *Transition issue: Respond to customer*
* IF ELSE *Issue matches: Status = "Waiting for customer" / "Customer Request Type" is not empty / Comment is public / User is a customer*
** THEN *Transition issue: Respond to support*{code}
# Login as Service Desk customer and use this customer to create a new issue through Customer Portal
# Login as agent and transition the new issue from _Waiting for Approval_ to _Waiting for Support_ and the screen to add a comment will pop out
# Add a public comment
# The status changes to _Waiting for Customer_ instead of _Waiting for Support_

h2.Expected Behavior

Service Desk should add the comment first and then transition the issue to the destination status 

h2.Current behavior

Service Desk transition to the destination status and then add the comment into the ticket 

h2. Workaround

Add the _Comment is primary action_ if condition to your automation rule so that it would look like

{code}* WHEN *Comment is added to an issue*
* IF *Issue matches: Status = "Waiting for support" / "Customer Request Type" is not empty / Comment is public / User is not a customer*
* AND *Comment is primary action
** THEN *Transition issue: Respond to customer*
* IF ELSE *Issue matches: Status = "Waiting for customer" / "Customer Request Type" is not empty / Comment is public / User is a customer*
* AND *Comment is primary action
** THEN *Transition issue: Respond to support*{code}
fields.summary: Comment added automation rule works unexpectedly

fields.description:
Steps to replicate:

# Create a new Service Desk request with new project
# Remove all the groups from the people's tab
# Remove all the groups from project role
# Navigate to https://<intstance name>/servicedesk/customer/portals
# Notice the project created is visible in the portal
# Issue can be still created

Expected behavior, since the all users does not have permission to even browse the project, it should not allow the project to be viewable on the portal at the first place.

Suspect: There are a new flag that allows customer to view the portal. Remove the flag seems to be fix the issue.

Workaround:
Run the follow query:
{noformat}
update "AO_54307E_SERVICEDESK" set "OPEN_CUSTOMER_ACCESS" = null where "OPEN_CUSTOMER_ACCESS" = 1;
{noformat}

This will unflag the *"OPEN_CUSTOMER_ACCESS"* flag and it should be remain hidden for unintended group.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Service Desk reports are showing in the 'month' drilldown for February issues created from March 1st, 2nd and 3rd, for some reason.

We can see these same ticket in March report as well.

As an example, this is a report for February:
 !filter_out_expired_users.png!

Notice the issue TSP-3 is shown. The same ticket is shown in March:
 !report_march.png|thumbnail!

This issue was created on March 3rd, so it should only show on March:
 !not_removed_from_Crowd.png!
h3. Environment

*Version is actually this one: 3.3.0-OD-1000.1111.1*, not available in "Affects Version/s"
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to a Service Desk project on March 1st, 2nd or 3rd
 # Go to any report in the project including those issues
 # Select 'Past year by month' in the dropdown menu
 # Click the 'February' month point in the graph (for a series containing issues from March)

h3. Expected Results

Only issues from February are shown in the details part.
h3. Actual Results

Issues from March 1st, 2nd and 3rd are also shown
h3. Workaround

This workaround may fix some but not all instances affected by this bug.

When the operating system timezone is _*behind*_ the timezone set in Jira user's profile (which may actually be the Jira default if they haven't changed it). Being behind the system TZ causes the label to be incorrect, which is why they appear to be in the wrong month.

Users can fix this discrepancy by either changing their own timezone ([via their JIRA profile|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira064/choosing-a-time-zone-720416101.html]) or the operating system timezone, as long as they match. Customers may need to quit and re-open their browser before the changes take effect.
fields.summary: SD reports are showing some issues from March in February drill down

fields.description:
h3. Summary

JSD comment box auto opens with loading/re-loading a Service Desk ticket on IE 11. 

h3. Environment
JIRA Version: 7.0.0-OD-08-001
JIRA Service Desk - 3.0.0-OD-04-002-D20150924T014602
IE 11: Version 11.0.9600.17843IS
Update Version: 11.0.20

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Log into instance on IE 11
# Open a Service Desk Project
# Open any issue is a new tab > When issue opens, the comment box opens up automatically 

h3. Expected Results

A JSD ticket should open ticket without opening up the Add Comment section automatically. User should not have to exit comment section when reviewing a JSD ticket. 

h3. Actual Results

Opening any ticket with the Service Desk project type will cause the comment section to open automatically without user clicking on the "click to add comment" section.
 
h3. Notes

Adds an additional, unnecessary step when reviewing Service Desk tickets in IE.

This only occurs in IE. I was able to reproduce in testing. Both FF and Chrome work as intended, comment box does not auto open when reviewing Service Desk issues.

h3.Workaround

User FF or Chrome.
fields.summary: Comment box (Click to add comment) automatically opens in IE when reviewing tickets

h3. Summary

When sending an email to an inbox for a JSD project, the additional email addresses on 'cc' or 'to', are added to the customer project list, an account gets created in the user management and they are added to the issue as a request participant even though public sign up is disabled.

 

Please not that this behaviour only happens when the email is being sent by a project administrator.
h3. Environment

JIRA Service Desk Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Disable public sign up in your JSD project. Both in the general JIRA Service Desk configuration and the project customer permissions. 
 # Send an email to your project inbox

h3. Expected Results

No new customer account gets created, added to the project list or added as request participant to the newly created ticket
h3. Actual Results

A new customer account gets created on the email in the 'to' or 'cc' field will be created and added to the customer project list and also included as a request participant in the newly created ticket. 
h3.
fields.summary: Email addresses in the 'to' or 'cc' field are added as request participants and to the project customer list when public sign up is disabled.

fields.description:
h3. Description:
New Service Desk automation rules are disabled and there is no indication in the UI that this is the case.


h3. How to reproduce:
* Create a new automation rule in Service Desk
* The rule is disabled, but this is not shown in the UI. It is not possible to change this without accessing the database

h3. Impact:
Affects all SD customers who create new automation rules, including evaluators.

h3. Workaround:
For customers: none at this time.
For support (with DB access): change the "ENABLED" column of the "AO_9B2E3B_RULE" table to true.

h3. Current status:
* Affects automation version 2.2.0-D20160607T051449 - currently in PRD and PRD-canaries
* Fixed in 2.2.0-D20160608T014556 - currently in PRD-pending (we will be pushing this through)
fields.summary: Service Desk new automation rules are disabled
API not labeled as experimental in documentation

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If you remove an issue type from the issue type scheme that's associated with a request type in Service Desk then that request type will still be visible in the customer portal, but it will throw the error 'Request type does not exist'

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a request type mapped with an issue type
# Remove that issue type from the issue type scheme associated with that project
# Try to create an issue with that request type

h3. Expected Results
 Request type shouldn't be there

h3. Actual Results
The request type is present, and when clicking it you get the error 'Request type does not exist' 

h3.Workaround
Run the following query to identify all issue types mapped to request types that aren't in the relevant issue type scheme. You can then add the issue type back to the issue type scheme and then remove the request type from the project. You can then remove the issue types once more.

{noformat}
select p.pkey as project_key, i.pname as issue_type_name, f."NAME" as portal_name from project p, "AO_54307E_VIEWPORTFORM" f, "AO_54307E_VIEWPORT" v, issuetype i where f."VIEWPORT_ID" = v."ID" and v."PROJECT_ID" = p.id and i.id::int = f."ISSUE_TYPE_ID" and p.projecttype = 'service_desk' and (p.pkey, i.id) not in (select p.pkey, i.id from project p, issuetype i, configurationcontext c, optionconfiguration o where p.id = c.project and c.fieldconfigscheme = o.fieldconfig and o.optionid = i.id and c.customfield = 'issuetype') and p.id in (select project from configurationcontext where customfield = 'issuetype') order by pkey asc;
{noformat}
fields.summary: Removing issue type from issue type scheme that's associated with a request type will throw 'Request type does not exist' error

fields.description:

Service Desk mail handler create comments in other JIRA issues if email subject have valid issues keys of issues from other JIRA Projects.

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a SD project
# Setup the mail handler
# Create another project and create an issue on it.
# Send an email that should generate a new issue in this SD project with the subject containing an issue key for the other project created.

h3. Expected Results
The SD handler should create a new issue.

h3. Actual Results
The new issue is not created and a comment is made in the other issue from the other project.

h3.Workaround
Not available.
fields.summary: Service Desk mail handler create comments in other JIRA issues if subject have valid issues keys
